TopicTitle: The Hitchiker's Guide didn't lie about the size of space...

Articles.Content:
> 
> Uuuumm... this doesn't look to scale at all! Might I recommend this beautiful website: [http://joshworth.com/dev/pixelspace/pixelspace_solarsystem.html](http://joshworth.com/dev/pixelspace/pixelspace_solarsystem.html)
> which shows the entire solar system to complete, accurate scale.

[If the Moon Were Only 1 Pixel](http://joshworth.com/dev/pixelspace/pixelspace_solarsystem.html)

(Same link as above)

Holy crud. I've been on this site for like ten minutes and still haven't made it through all of the planets... ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
You know, you can just hit the 2 arrows at the top to skip to the next message. Also, so you know, I didn't make this. Found it in a Vsauce video.

> 
> You know, you can just hit the 2 arrows at the top to skip to the next message. Also, so you know, I didn't make this. Found it in a Vsauce video.

But then you don't get the full *scale*... It's an experience, I'll say. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Twice as far as the chemists, according to Adams, was it not? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

That was a joke, for anyone objecting. He said something along those lines, but not quite that.

They added a scrollbar to that site. A valuable addition, I would say, as previously it was excellent at impressing the point, but somewhat boring too.

Wow! Just finished scrolling through. The site really shows the true scale of our solar system, it's big! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
